In the West Bank, children are the target of Israeli soldiers
subhead: According to the United Nations, since January, Israeli troops have killed 44 minors in the Palestinian territory. None of those responsible have faced prosecution or disciplinary action. Most of the time, the army does not even bother to open an investigation.

United Kingdom struggles to acknowledge the far right's rise
subhead: The UK, which resisted the Nazis during World War II, long believed itself immune to radical ideologies. Yet the rising popularity of Nigel Farage's Reform UK party, which plans to massively deport immigrants, suggests otherwise.

title: French-Palestinian activist files complaint for 'deportation' after his expulsion from Israel in 2022
subhead: Salah Hamouri's lawyers also accuse Israel of crimes of 'persecution' and 'segregation,' after he was banned from the territory where he was born and raised. An earlier complaint, filed in 2024, alleged 'torture' during his periods of administrative detention in Israel and is already under investigation.

title: 2026 Grammys: Kendrick Lamar leads nominations, followed by Lady Gaga, Jack Antonoff and Cirkut
subhead: The rapper is up for nine trophies at February's ceremony: record, song and album of the year. Lady Gaga, Jack Antonoff and Canadian record producer/songwriter Cirkut follow Lamar with seven nominations each.

title: 'Made in France' clothing manufacturers struggle to survive amid competition from fast fashion
subhead: French brands are struggling to keep their factories running and sell their products, squeezed by competition from low-cost fast fashion brands like the Chinese giant Shein. To survive, some are turning to direct sales online.

Marlene Dumas becomes first contemporary woman artist to join the Louvre's permanent collection
subhead: She has exhibited her work in the world's most prestigious museums and her paintings have broken auction records. The Dutch-South African painter has created a body of work shaped by the traumas of her time. At 72, she joins the Louvre with a series of nine portraits. This event illustrates the shift sought by Louvre Director Laurence des Cars, one that she is maintaining even after the institution was the target of a dramatic jewelry heist.

title: In 'Slide,' a cowboy and his guitar restore justice in Oregon
subhead: In his new animated film, American director Bill Plympton delivers a western of extraordinary fluidity, drawn entirely in ink pen.

title: War in Ukraine: Battle for Pokrovsk enters final phase
subhead: Russian infantry are advancing inside the city, one of the last major urban centers in the Donetsk region still under Kyiv's control. Moscow's shift in tactics – focusing on destroying Ukrainian logistics – has paid off after six months.
